body_html:
Thanks @saxenasaurabh @vrv. I managed to update the PR and the hop_bytes_ should have been covered as well.

It use similar an approach of caching a buffer for hop_bytes.

Basically the purpose is to avoid the need to randomly seek to a position of the file stream. Now the file stream (possibly gzip or zlib) could be "read through" without moving backward. (gzip or zlib does not support moving backward as they are not "seekable").

The comment has been expanded to explain the logic but let me know if more explanation is needed.

The comment has been expanded to explain the logic but let me know if more explanation is needed.
body:
Thanks @saxenasaurabh @vrv. I managed to update the PR and the `hop_bytes_` should have been covered as well.

It use similar an approach of caching a buffer for `hop_bytes`.

Basically the purpose is to avoid the need to randomly seek to a position of the file stream. Now the file stream (possibly gzip or zlib) could be "read through" without moving backward. (gzip or zlib does not support moving backward as they are not "seekable").

The comment has been expanded to explain the logic but let me know if more explanation is needed.
